title: Qiagen shares stumble on sales warning, CEO departure
text: Qiagen QIA, -20.04% shares stumbled 17% as the diagnostics firm said third-quarter sales at constant exchange rates will grow 3% instead of the previous estimate of 4% to 5% growth. Qiagen blamed the downturn on weaker-than-expected developments in China. Qiagen also announced its CEO, Peer Schatz, will resign. Further, Qiagen decided to suspend ongoing next-generation sequencing-related instrument development activities and take a pretax restructuring charge between $260 million and $265 million.
